resources.string: When enabled, Text Secretary will only auto respond if the user is in a calendar event. Text Secretary will check all of the available calendars in the user’s device. Text Secretary will also enter the name and end time of the event if the user puts [name] and/or [end] into their Custom Message with Calendar On. For example:

Text Secretary’s Single Response capability is used to prevent auto responding too quickly to the same contact. In other words, when Text Secretary auto responds to a contact, Text Secretary will not auto respond to that same contact for a certain amount of time. For example:

Enabling Single Response also adds sophistication to outgoing messages. For example, if the user sends a message and someone then responds while Single Response is enabled, Text Secretary will not auto-respond. For example:
The Text Secretary widget allows users to quickly turn on and off all Text Secretary features without ever opening up the app.

If enabled, your device will be automatically silenced. If Calendar Integration is on, silencing will only occur when in an event. If Driving Detection is enabled, silencing will also occur while you are driving. When you are no longer in a meeting or driving, the previous volume setting will be restored.

When Driving Detection is enabled, Text Secretary, using Google location services (which must be enabled), will auto-respond to texts and missed phone calls when the user is driving. This detection is done automatically in the background with minimal battery impact.

Text Secretary will notify the user when it detects that they are driving. There is a button in this notification to dismiss the driving detection for the ride. This is useful if the user is simply a passenger.
